page.title: 13Siege (2) in Kings Heath
page.content: Terror came to the heart of the suburb at 1.55 am., when a policewoman and a policeman were called to{Drayton Road} to investigate a resident's complaint that a man and a woman were shouting at each other in the street. When the officers arrived there was no sign of trouble, then{someone fired a shotgun} and the policewoman was hit. She suffered two or three pellet wounds. The gunman then fired four or five shots at police officers. The police {evacuated some residents}from the street, but they believed it was safer for people living near the siege to stay where they were. Parents of children at the nearby{St. Dunstans Primary School}were told in an {emergency police message on radio}to keep youngsters at home. The siege ended at 3.45 when the police persuaded the gunman to give himself up.
